intro: Diasperus maderaspatensis, commonly known as the Maderaspatensis Diasperus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
